snippet: Mitt Romney may have won in Michigan, but the out-of-touch Republican campaigns ignore the problems of blue-collar voters.
abstract: Editorial contends that acrimonious battle between Rick Santorum and Mitt Romney over the Michigan primary may have cost the Republican party that state in the general election; holds that both candidates ran campaigns that were completely disconnected from the lives of middle-class voters; notes that Pres Obama capitalized on this disconnect during fiery speech to the United Auto Workers.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney may have won in Michigan, but the out-of-touch Republican campaigns ignore the problems of blue-collar voters.

headline.print_headline: Romney Wins, the Middle Class Loses
headline.seo: Romney Wins and the Middle Class Loses
headline.main: Romney Wins, the Middle Class Loses
